channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: #102 - Patch in Paris
item.description:
Hi,

I am not sure what happened, but this week we are full on both web-related and database related articles. There is also this French hackathon we missed earlier, but it is less than 3 weeks from now. So if you don't know how to spend your vacation time, I can recommend visiting Paris and sitting in a dark room with a lot of other Perl hackers.

Or maybe using that as an excuse to visit Paris.

Either way, enjoy!

Oh and let me thank Dean Hamstead who recommended the Perl Weekly for the Syndey.pm members. He brought in 20 new, and hopefully happy, subscribers.

item.title: We're Hiring Telecommuters - Grant Street Group
item.description:
We're a growing software company using open source software/modern Perl practices to build innovative e-payment, auction, and tax collection web applications.
We're looking for talented, motivated professionals committed to flawless work and customer service.
Email resume: 106686-CS-6734@grantstreet.hrmdirect.com

item.title: patch -p0
item.description: Do you know how to say patch in French? You have a chance now to learn it. The French Perl Mongers are organizing the 0th patch event in Paris.

item.title: Parsing Ada Lovelace
item.description: Jeffrey Kegler helps us understand Victorian English using Perl and Marpa.

item.title: Use the logical-or and defined-or operators to provide default subroutine variable behaviour
item.description: Article by David Farrell

item.title: Common reasons a module won't install
item.description: David Farrell (sillymoose) asked the readers to help him with the list for an upcoming article.

item.title: Use Test::Most for Quick Debugging
item.description: Use environment variables to tell your test to bail out on the first sign of distress. A very good way to save time while fixing a test failure.

item.title: How to install DBD::Oracle
item.description: After reading the instructions, it does not seem as difficult as I thought. Of course one needs to read the instructions for that.

item.title: Notes on Upcoming Sqitch Improvements
item.description: MySQL support, starting from v5.6.4 and an SQLite backwards-incompatible change.

item.title: Install and Configure the MS ODBC Driver on Debian
Replacing your engine
item.description: After encountering the Regex engine of the Go programming engine, Tim Heaney tried to see how can you use the same engine in Perl, Python in Ruby. This engine can improve the speed of some of your regexes.

item.title: UAV::Pilot v0.4 Released, Now Supports Video
item.description: So now you can use Perl and your drone to spy on the neighbor. I am glad some people do real work with Perl!

item.title: Encapsulating Responsibility in Methods
item.description: Ovid explains how Object Oriented programming can hide complexities. If you follow the pattern he outlines, you will see the number of parameters you need to pass shrinking. Which is always a good thing.

item.title: Setting up MovableType on a basic webspace
item.description: Would you like to have a Perl-based blog engine? Sebastian Willing shares his experience setting up MovableType on a shared hosting account.

item.title: Updated Perl Catalyst Development Proposals On Questhub
item.description: Questhub is what used to be Play-Perl. It is a cooperative self-encouragement site written in Perl.

item.title: The state of SOAP::Lite - here comes 1.0
item.description: Including a big Makefile cleanup that might break your installation. Please test!

item.title: Dancer Applications As CPAN Modules
item.description: It is not straight-forward how you could distribute a Dancer based Perl application as a CPAN module. Yanick show us the way with his buzzword-compliant Markdown-based presentation app,

item.title: Rakudo on JVM Progress Update
item.description: Rakudo on JVM is now passing 92% of the tests that Rakudo on Parrot does! (...and that was written a week ago.) Soon we can say that Perl is running on 3 billion devices. On top of the JVM. Are we in game then?

item.title: All about Perl 6 â€“ interview of Jonathan Worthington (Part 1 of 3)
item.description: A text only interview conducted by Nikos Vaggalis. Jonathan is comparing C# with Perl, Parrot with the JVM and with MoarVM

item.title: Perl, Python, Ruby, PHP, C, C++, Lua, tcl, javascript and Java comparison
item.description: Recently Olivier Valuet pointed me at this article. I don't remember seeing it before. Certainly interesting. Especially as I am doing some Perl vs. Python vs. Ruby comparisons myself lately.

item.title: MetaCPAN weekly report - Email::Stuffer, Mojolicious, Smart::Comments, Type::Tiny
Variable number of parameters in Perl subroutines
@ARGV in Perl
item.description: Collecting the command line arguments of a Perl script.

item.title: Notes from YAPC in Austin
item.description: Better late than never. Ricardo Signes posted his experience at YAPC::NA that was held in Austin, TX a month ago.

item.title: YAPC Conference Surveys Update
item.description: Barbie is doing his regular follow-up survey. Unfortunately the response rate was quite low this year.

item.title: patch -p0 hackathon
item.description: July 26-28, 2013, Paris, France

item.title: Beijing Perl Workshop
item.description: August 10, 2013, Beijing, China

item.title: YAPC::EU 2013
item.description: August 12-14, 2013, Kiev, Ukraine

item.title: YAPC::Asia Tokyo
item.description: September 19-21, 2013, Keio University Hiyoshi Campus, Tokyo, Japan
